resources.string:
This is a new feature!
 You don't need to watch the screen to pilot the drone any more.
 In fact the cursor is redrawn and centered wherever you touch the screen.
 In this way the drone doesn't move at the first touch, it starts moving only
 if you move your finger around the screen.
 The standard cursors are fixed, so you need to watch the screen to point
 your finger toward the center to avoid moving the drone.
 Try it!
 You can drive the drone without watching the screen now.
 If your finger is too close to the bounds of screen then
 the application will create a feedback vibration.

This is a new feature!
 You can swap the x, y, z axis of analog pilot cursors.
 (x = left/right, y = altitude, z = frontward/backward)
 In this way you can use the right cursor to obtain a death loop
 and left cursor to generate arcs.
 It is a new way to pilot a drone.
 Some inputs can't be executed because they are not supported
 by the propeller motor.
 Try it!
You can scale the speed of the propeller motors, so you can reduce\n the speed for smooth flight
The led shows you the battery level in percentage format. 4.2V is 100%
The led shows you the power level of the BLE drone connection in db.

The "Offset" left/right button enables you to swap between the analogic/digital cursor.
 By pressing the same button the cursor types are swapped.
 If offset is pressed, the digital cursors change the offset Yaw,
 pitch and roll and altitude by 1/128 of their max value for each click.

Third Action before starting
 The "Take_off" button is for drone take-off.
 During this phase it is necessary to use the altitude cursor to stop the drone.
 Once the drone is flying, the same button becomes "Land" for landing.

Second Action before starting
 The first button is for sensor calibration, so the drone gyroscpe sensor starts 
 from the correct value, because the drone board may not be completely horizontal 
 The Take_off button requires a 1 sec press to become active. 
 If the button is pressed for at least 1 sec, then button becomes
 green for 2 sec else red for 2 sec. 
 Use it before taking off.
 The second button is for arming the propeller motors.
 Once the drone is flying, the same button will stop the propeller motors.
 The Stop button is the last possible option to stop the drone
 when you have lost control of the drone.
 The third item is the led to indicate the Arming status
 (green is armed, red is not armed).

First action before starting
 The "Connection" button enables drone connection via BLE.
 After pressing, the page becomes the connection page
 to search and select your drone in the list.
 Click on your drone to connect and the page will return to the homepage.
 The button changes color in order to indicate the connection status:
 				Blue light is for starting connection phase.
 				green means connected.
 				Yellow means searching connection.
 				Red means no connection.

The first selector is for enabling drone sensor data: 
 				Accelerometer
 				Gyroscope
 				Magnetometer
 				Pressure
 				Altitude
 Instead of -STDrone software version- you will see
 the sensor data with their metrics.
 The second selector is for enabling or disabling log file generation
 with the drone sensor data timestamp.
 Please be careful!!!
 the filenames are always different,
 so you need to remember to manually delete obsolete files
 The directory is stored in the main root of your sdcard:
 /STMicroelectronics/logs
The selector is to enable or disable Yaw (this type of activation is suggested for beginners)\n

The selector is for switching between the square or circle shaped cursor.
 The square is optimum to have the right correspondence with the drone's dynamics.
 In fact the maximum speed is at the corner of square.
 Before moving, you can rotate to 45 degrees in the right direction by using Yaw.
 Then you can try the maximum speed moving your finger to the corner of square.

The "Sensitivity" button is for moving into the Sensitivity page
 to set the Sensitivity Analog Cursor
 The speed at which your fingers move are usually proportional
 to the speed rotation request for the propeller motors
 The Sensitivity page enables nonlinear behaviour.
 In particular it is possible to increase the speed slope rate
 when you touch the cursor for the first time.
 Start slope rate can be increased by setting the sensitivity seek bar value, 
 but this is limited to the beginning only (due to inherent maximum speed limitations of motor, 
 which are reached at the outside limit of the circle)
 Hence this functionality works best around at the centre of the circle

The seek bar changes the start slope rate of sensitivity
 when you press the cursor for the first time.
 The selectors are for Yaw, Pitch/Roll and Altitude.
 The value can change from 1 to the Max value.
 1 is to disable nonlinear behaviour, so speed rotation request
 is proportional to finger speed 
 x value means x times higher than the proportional speed only for the first touch
 If you choose to increase start slope rate then please be aware that
 the speed increase will be best at the centre of the circle
 and that the nonlinear behaviour (i.e finger speed vs. motor speed)increases as you approach the outside of the circle
 causing a relative speed decrease

The selector is for the change seek bar scope
 If -Start slope rate Max- is selected the Max range can change by seek bar
 There is a mininum (invariable) value
 Changing the maximum values, except for nonlinear disable, also start slope rate
 change whose value can then be seen
